Key Match Events: Yashasvi Jaiswal scored 93 runs to help India win by 10 wickets.
Shubman Gill scored a valuable half-century in support of Jaiswal.
Pre-Game Insights: Shubman Gill won the toss and put Zimbabwe into bat.
Sikandar Raza led Zimbabwe's batting effort and scored a match-winning 2000th international run.
The surface was described as very hard with not much grass, favoring the batters.
Post-Match Reflections: Sikandar Raza expressed disappointment in the fielding and conceded 20 extra runs.
Shubman Gill praised the team's start with bat and ball and highlighted the importance of executing plans to restrict Zimbabwe.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match ended with India beating Zimbabwe by 10 wickets and sealing the series 3-1.
The final game of the series will be played on Sunday at 4:30 PM IST in Harare.
Yashasvi Jaiswal's 93 runs and Shubman Gill's half-century helped India chase 157 without losing a wicket and 28 balls to spare.
Others: Zimbabwe's top three openers had put on a 50-run opening partnership.
India's top-heavy lineup meant Sanju Samson and Rinku Singh only managed 8 deliveries between them.
